title: China Immediately Retaliates Against Trump Tariffs. Coal, Gas and Google Are Targets.
text: China hit back at the U.S. with tariffs of its own. Beijing also said it was starting an antitrust probe into Alphabet's Google.

title: China reportedly hits back in Trump tariff wars targeting Google and others
text: China has announced new measures targeting US businesses, including Google, farm equipment manufacturers, and PVH Corp, the owner of Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger. The move follows Washington's latest tariffs on Chinese imports.

title: Google appeals Play Store monopoly verdict
text: Google has launched an appeal against a ruling declaring its Play Store an illegal monopoly. Having lost a case brought by Fortnite maker Epic Games, Google argued in a San Francisco court on Monday that legal errors had been made in the previous judgment.

title: Alphabet Earnings Could Provide Answers on AI and Cloud Concerns
text: Analysts surveyed by FactSet expect Alphabet to report a jump in earnings and revenue.

title: China hits back at Trump tariffs with Google antitrust investigation
text: China said Tuesday it has launched an antitrust investigation into Google, part of a swift retaliation after the U.S. President Donald Trump imposed a 10% tariff on Chinese goods.

title: China anti-monopoly regulator launches probe into Google
text: China's anti-monopoly regulator said on Tuesday it had launched an investigation into Alphabet's Google, minutes after an additional 10% tariff on Chinese goods imposed by U.S. President Donald Trump came into effect.

title: China to launch antitrust probe into Google
text: China to launch antitrust probe into Google

title: Alphabet Likely to Face Investor Questions About AI-Related Capital Expenditures
text: When Google parent company Alphabet reports earnings Tuesday (Feb. 4), it is reportedly likely to face questions from investors about the amount it is spending on artificial intelligence (AI). The company is estimated to have spent $50 billion on AI in 2024 and is expected to spend more in 2025, Reuters reported Monday (Feb. 3).

title: Amazon & Alphabet Earnings: Key Metrics to Watch
text: We continue to wade through the 2024 Q4 earnings cycle, with a wide variety of companies unveiling quarterly results daily.

title: Fast Money: GOOGL, CAT, EQT, DSGX
text: The final trades of the day with CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders.

title: Google Cloud growth, cost-cutting could drive fourth quarter earnings upside, analysts believe
text: Google's parent company Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOG)'s Cloud segment growth could drive upside in its earnings report due after Tuesday's closing bell, analysts at Wedbush believe. “While digital advertising demand remains strong for both Search and YouTube, we think it will be difficult for Alphabet to materially outperform expectations for advertising growth in the near-term, given recent FX headwinds and more challenging comps in 4Q and through 2025,” they wrote in a note to clients.

title: Alphabet faces scrutiny on AI spending as Google cloud growth slows
text: Alphabet will face investor scrutiny over its massive spending on AI when it reports earnings on Tuesday, as revenue growth at the Google parent likely slowed in the holiday quarter due to a slowdown in its advertising and cloud businesses.

title: AAPL, GOOGL & META "Undervalued," "Bank" NVDA for 24 Months
text: "President Trump is giving us a discount," says Jeffrey Small on reaction to today's tariffs on Canada, Mexico and China. He believes 2025 will be a winning year for Wall Street with names like Apple (AAPL), Alphabet (GOOGL) and Meta Platforms (META) as "undervalued" plays.

title: Google to Seek Reversal of Judge's App Store Order
text: Google and Epic Games will reportedly be in court Monday (Feb. 3) as Google seeks a reversal of a judge's order that it allow rival app stores with its Play store.

title: Trade Tracker: Joe Terranova buys Alphabet and sells Microsoft
text: Joe Terranova, Senior Managing Director for Virtus Investment Partners, joins CNBC's "Halftime Report" to explain his latest portfolio moves.

title: Nvidia vs. Alphabet: Which Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock Should You Buy After the Emergence of China's DeepSeek?
text: The emergence of a small Chinese artificial intelligence (AI) company called DeepSeek initially put a giant hole in the U.S. stock market. Tech stocks -- particularly those connected to the AI trend -- got crushed, and GPU king Nvidia (NVDA -3.37%) lost roughly $600 billion of its market cap in a single day as investors grew concerned about the company's moat, and whether AI software could be trained and powered at lower costs with less powerful chips.

title: Google to ask US appeals court to overturn app store monopoly ruling
text: Google is preparing to head back to court on Monday to appeal a ruling that found its app store was a monopoly -- one of three major antitrust suits against the tech firm.

title: Here's Why Alphabet (GOOGL) is a Strong Growth Stock
text: Wondering how to pick strong, market-beating stocks for your investment portfolio? Look no further than the Zacks Style Scores.

title: Will Google Cloud's Robust Performance Aid Alphabet's Q4 Earnings?
text: GOOGL's fourth-quarter 2024 results are likely to reflect strength in generative AI, search and cloud.

title: Amazon, Alphabet, Disney earnings reports: what investors should know
text: This earnings week is a pivotal moment for investors, with Amazon, Alphabet, and Disney at the centre of financial markets' attention. While analysts traditionally focus on revenue and profitability, this quarter's results are about more than just numbers.

title: Monster insider trading alert for Google stock
text: Google's (NASDAQ: GOOGL) valuation relative to earnings might not be as high as some of its rivals and competitors — but like other tech giants, the company is faced with factors that could end up being major headwinds.

title: Google to ask US appeals court to overturn app store verdict
text: Lawyers for Alphabet's Google and "Fortnite" maker Epic Games are set to square off before a U.S. appeals court in California on Monday, as Google tries to undo a jury verdict and a judge's order forcing it to revamp its app store.
